entity1.name: Cryptocurrencies
entity1.description: A distributed ledger technology that maintains a permanent and tamper-proof record of transaction data, supporting the operation of cryptocurrencies.;;;Currencies that exist primarily in electronic form and are used for online transactions, often based on blockchain technology.;;;Self-executing contracts with the terms of the agreement directly written into code.;;;A form of currency that exists primarily in digital or electronic form, used for transactions and investments.;;;Digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and operate independently of a central bank.;;;A distributed ledger technology that ensures the transparency and immutability of transactions on the network.;;;Alternative cryptocurrencies that were launched after the success of Bitcoin, often with different features and improvements.;;;A decentralized digital ledger that records transactions across many computers in such a way that the registered transactions cannot be altered retroactively.;;;A digital or virtual currency that uses cryptography for security and operates independently of a central bank.;;;Digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and are decentralized, allowing for peer-to-peer transactions without the need for a central authority.;;;Digital representations of value that can be traded or transferred electronically.;;;Digital or virtual currencies that use cryptography for security and are decentralized, operating independently of a central bank.;;;A decentralized digital currency that uses cryptography for security and is the first and most well-known cryptocurrency.;;;A distributed ledger technology that maintains a permanent and tamper-proof record of transaction data, supporting decentralized applications and cryptocurrencies.

entity4.name: Satoshi Nakamoto
entity4.description: The pseudonym used by the unknown person or group of people who developed Bitcoin and created its original reference implementation.

entity7.name: decentralized nature

entity8.name: fiat currencies
entity8.description: Traditional forms of currency that are issued by governments and controlled by central banks.

entity9.name: governments
entity9.description: Organizations or bodies that have the authority to govern a country, region, or community.;;;Organizations with the authority to govern and make decisions on behalf of a population, typically within a defined geographical area.

entity10.name: central banks
entity10.description: Banks responsible for overseeing the monetary system of a nation or group of nations.

entity15.name: block
entity15.description: A unit of data in a blockchain that contains multiple transactions and is linked to the previous block.

entity16.name: network
entity16.description: The interconnected group of computers or nodes that validate and maintain the integrity of the blockchain.

entity23.name: financial inclusion
entity23.description: The process of ensuring access to financial services and timely, adequate credit where needed by vulnerable groups such as weaker sections and low-income groups, in an equitable and affordable manner.

entity26.name: investors
entity26.description: Individuals or organizations that allocate capital with the expectation of generating a profit, often through the purchase and sale of financial assets.

entity27.name: speculators
entity27.description: Individuals who trade in risky financial instruments with the aim of making quick profits from short-term price movements, often without holding the asset for long periods.

entity29.name: Regulation
entity29.description: The process of creating and enforcing rules to manage the behavior of individuals or organizations, particularly in financial contexts.

entity32.name: regulatory bodies
entity32.description: Official organizations responsible for setting standards and enforcing rules in specific industries or sectors.

entity35.name: money laundering
entity35.description: The process of making illegally-gained proceeds appear legal.

entity36.name: tax evasion
entity36.description: The illegal act of not paying or underpaying taxes owed to the government.

entity37.name: consumer protection
entity37.description: Laws and regulations designed to protect consumers from unfair practices by businesses.

entity46.name: money
entity46.description: A current medium of exchange in the form of coins and banknotes; anything that is generally accepted as payment for goods and services and repayment of debts.
